decision_conditions: Cover Letter dated 24 June 2024; Letter from AECOM Ltd dated 14 June 2024; BREEAM QA Timescales (as of 30/05/2024).
description:
Non material amendment to planning permission ref. P2023/2609/FUL dated 27/03/2024 in order to amend the wording and triggers/timings of condition 21 (BREEAM requirements) in relation to the submission of the relevant interim and post completion accredited BREEAM Certificates.

CONDITION: Evidence confirming that the development achieves a BREEAM RFO rating (2014) of no less than 'Excellent' shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The evidence shall be provided in the following formats and at the following times:

a)	a design stage assessment, supported by relevant BRE interim certificate(s), shall be submitted no later than 6 months after commencement of the construction stage; and 

b)	a post-construction assessment, supported by relevant BRE accreditation certificate(s), shall be submitted no later than 18 months after practical completion of the development. 

The development shall be carried out strictly in accordance with the details so approved and achieve the agreed rating(s)
REASON: In the interest of addressing climate change and to secure sustainable development.
